publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-412 Richard Lochhead: Nigel Tranter—That the Parliament records the gratitude of the people of Scotland to the late Nigel Tranter, one of Scotland’s greatest storytellers, for his contribution to the campaign for a Scottish Parliament, rediscovery and restoration of the fortified houses of Scotland and his role in making Scotland’s history accessible to her people. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder*, Alasdair Morgan*, Mr Andrew Welsh*, Irene McGugan*, Mr John Swinney*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Michael Matheson*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Andrew Wilson*, Linda Fabiani*, Brian Adam*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Kay Ullrich*, Michael Russell*, Fiona Hyslop*
S1M-412 Nigel Tranter (lodged on 12 January 2000) Dr Winnie Ewing*, Mr David Davidson*, Shona Robison*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Scott Barrie*

S1M-412 Richard Lochhead: Nigel Tranter—That the Parliament records the gratitude of the people of Scotland to the late Nigel Tranter, one of Scotland’s greatest storytellers, for his contribution to the campaign for a Scottish Parliament, rediscovery and restoration of the fortified houses of Scotland and his role in making Scotland’s history accessible to her people. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alasdair Morgan, Mr Andrew Welsh, Irene McGugan, Mr John Swinney, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Michael Matheson, Nicola Sturgeon, Andrew Wilson, Linda Fabiani, Brian Adam, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Kay Ullrich, Michael Russell, Fiona Hyslop, Dr Winnie Ewing, Mr David Davidson, Shona Robison, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Keith Harding*, David Mundell*

S1M-412 Nigel Tranter (lodged on 12 January 2000) Donald Gorrie*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*
